senses.de: To suggest or show something without stating it directly.

Tips.title: Subtle Hinting
Tips.description: Use 'imply' to subtly hint at something without openly saying it.
Tips.example: He implied that they were more than just friends.

Tips.title: Not Stated
Tips.description: 'Imply' is used when the speaker does not want to state something explicitly.
Tips.example: She implied her displeasure with a frown.

Tips.title: Listener's Interpretation
Tips.description: 'Imply' requires the listener to interpret the meaning beyond the words spoken.
Tips.example: His choice of words implied a hidden agenda.

senses.de: To involve or include as a necessary condition or result.
senses.ex: Building a new house implies a big investment.

Tips.title: Necessity
Tips.description: Use 'imply' to indicate that something is a necessary part of the situation or action.

Tips.title: Cause and Effect
Tips.description: 'Imply' can express a cause-and-effect relationship implicitly.

senses.de: To make someone understand something by suggesting it rather than by saying it directly.
senses.ex: Are you implying that I'm not capable?

Tips.title: Academic Precision
Tips.description: In academic writing, 'imply' signifies a precise suggestion made without direct evidence.
Tips.example: The data imply a correlation, not causation.

Tips.title: Careful Conveyance
Tips.description: 'Imply' often conveys sensitive information without making direct accusations.
Tips.example: Are you implying there was foul play involved?

Tips.title: Indirect Explanation
Tips.description: Use 'imply' to explain or make someone understand something indirectly.
Tips.example: The professor implied that the exam would be tough.

Allude.wordDefinition:
Allude means to indirectly reference or suggest something, often by using a word or phrase that has a hidden meaning. For example, if someone says "I wouldn't want to be in his shoes," they are alluding to the fact that the person being discussed is likely in a challenging or difficult situation.

The key difference between the two words is that allude is more indirect, while imply is more direct. Allude is usually used when you want to hint at something without saying it outright, while imply is used when you want to state something more directly.

Connote.wordDefinition:
Connote means to bring to mind a secondary meaning or association with a word beyond its literal definition.

For example, the word 'home' may connote feelings of warmth, comfort and security.

To summarize, imply is used when suggesting something indirectly, while connote is used when bringing to mind secondary associations or meanings with a word.

Hint.wordDefinition:
Hint means to suggest or give an indirect clue about something. For example, if someone says "I could really go for some ice cream right now," they are hinting that they would like to have some ice cream.

Hint is used to suggest something indirectly, while imply is used to suggest something without actually saying it.

Infer.wordDefinition:
Infer means to draw a conclusion or make an educated guess based on the information available. For example, if someone says "I love ice cream," you could infer that they might want you to buy them some ice cream.

Imply is used when someone is hinting at something, while infer is used when someone is drawing a conclusion based on that hint.

Insinuate.wordDefinition:
Insinuate means to suggest something indirectly or in a way that is not very clear. For example: "Are you insinuating that I stole the money?" This implies that the other person may think you stole the money, but they are not directly accusing you.

Imply is used when someone suggests something without saying it directly and insinuate is used when someone suggests something in an indirect or unclear way.

It's important to be careful when using these words so that you don't accidentally offend or upset someone by implying or insinuating something that you didn't mean to.

Intimate.wordDefinition:
Intimate means to suggest or hint at something in a more personal or emotional way. For example, if someone says "I'm feeling a bit down today", they may be intimating that they need emotional support or comfort.

Imply is more commonly used in casual conversation, while intimate is used in more personal and emotional contexts.

Suggest.wordDefinition:
The words imply and suggest are both used to convey a meaning indirectly, but there is a slight difference in the way they are used.

Imply means to hint or suggest something indirectly without explicitly stating it. For example, if someone says "I didn't see you at the party," they might be implying that they wished you had come.

Suggest means to propose an idea or offer something for consideration. For example, if someone says "I suggest we go to a movie," they are offering an idea for consideration.

Both words are applicable in different situations. Imply is used when someone wants to convey a message without being too direct or confrontational, while suggest is used when someone wants to offer an idea or recommendation.

quotes.Text: To the extent that we even understand string theory, it may imply a massive number of possible different universes with different laws of physics in each universe, and there may be no way of distinguishing between them or saying why the laws of physics are the way they are. And if I can predict anything, then I haven't explained anything.
quotes.Title: American Physicist
quotes.Name: Lawrence M. Krauss

quotes.Text: I think that cancer is a life form that exists out there, and it exists in us. I think even the concept of healing is a spiritual principle that we have to really look at. I think the word itself is something we ought to get rid of, because it implies that there is illness - that there is something wrong.
quotes.Title: American Psychologist
quotes.Name: Wayne Dyer

quotes.Text: I crave and seek a natural explanation of all phenomena upon this earth, but the word 'natural' to me implies more than mere chemistry and physics. The birth of a baby and the blooming of a flower are natural events, but the laboratory methods forever fail to give us the key to the secret of either.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: John Burroughs

quotes.Text: Post-minimalism implies music that's genre-less. Minimalism was very important because it came at a time when contemporary music had become so complex, so experimental and detached that people turned away from it. Minimalism broke that trend and brought music back to the people.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Maya Beiser

quotes.Text: They keep telling us that in war truth is the first casualty, which is nonsense since it implies that in times of peace truth stays out of the sick bay or the graveyard.
quotes.Title: English Journalist
quotes.Name: Alexander Cockburn

quotes.Text: Where defining foreign policy as 'ethical' went wrong was that it implied that all decisions would be exclusive in every respect of any dealings with unethical regimes.
quotes.Title: British Politician
quotes.Name: William Hague

quotes.Text: For, usually and fitly, the presence of an introduction is held to imply that there is something of consequence and importance to be introduced.
quotes.Title: Welsh Author
quotes.Name: Arthur Machen

quotes.Text: Every right implies a responsibility; Every opportunity, an obligation, Every possession, a duty.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: John D. Rockefeller

quotes.Text: I don't like when I say 'honestly' - not to imply that I'm otherwise not honest.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Mark Parker
